description:
Microsoft Jigsaw is free-to-play collection of jigsaw puzzles. The jigsaws are sorted into themed collections and when starting out the player has access to two of these but there are more available for download. Most of these need to be paid for but there are also some that are free. Each collection consists of a certain number of puzzles with three available from the start while the rest has to be unlocked by completing previous ones. For each completed puzzle the player earns gold which is the in-game currency and can be used to acquire new collections. New collections can also be bought with real money. The amount of gold earned depends on the difficulty level (number of pieces). The easiest one has just 24 pieces while the hardest one has 216 pieces.

In addition to the classic jigsaw puzzles there are two additional game modes: jigsaw jam and daily challenges. Jigsaw jam is a timed mode where the player is given one piece at a time and has to quickly find its place. Daily challenges appear every day and by completing these the player earns coins. The aim is to get badges by earning certain amounts of coins within a month. There are three different types of challenges: jigsaw jam as described above, lock breaker where the the player has to link a certain number of pieces in a certain number of moves to a locked piece and bug catcher where the player has to place the pieces so that a bug is surrounded on all sides. The game also allows the player to create his own custom puzzles by importing images. These can then be exported and shared with other people.

The game features Xbox support that allows the player to earn achievements, compete with friends, submit scores to the leaderboards and track various statistics.

sample_screenshots.caption: Make a mistake and the chain breaks

title: Microsoft Jigsaw

description:
Monsters Love Candy is a match-three puzzle game based around locating and removing matches from a board. The game is played on a board filled with pieces of candy of different colours. To score points the player has to draw a pattern of three identical pieces or more, either horizontal, vertical or diagonal. A match is not limited to a single direction, but can be long-winded in different directions across the entire board as long as the identical pieces are always connected in one of the three directions. There is no time limit, but longer combinations yield more points than smaller ones in succession. The pieces of candy that disappear in a match are replaced by new ones that appear from the top. There is an additional real-time mechanic to build combos. Whenever a match is created, there is a small time window to quickly draw a new pattern. If this is done quickly enough, multiple matches can be created in a single go that all disappear at once, for even more points. When the player is too slow, the drawn matches are executed and removed.

In the game the player is a research assistant of a professor. The goal is to document and adopt different monsters in different environments with 35 monsters in each world and categories such as common, rare, legendary or mythical. In a level the monster is shown on the left side of the board. Each match fills a meter on the left side and when a certain amount has been reached, the monster is fed enough candy and the level is won. By creating a match of at least twenty pieces (in one go or through consecutive matches executed quickly in succession), a super candy is created for a large meter boost. When enough candy is collected the monster also evolves to a new form. When the level is completed the monster is stored in a scrapbook and it can optionally be adopted. Next to the basic currency of coins, the premium currency of purple gems is required to have additional storage slots. Experience is gained to level up.

Next to a different look each monster has a specific set of boosters. These can appear next to the pieces of candy on the board. When a booster is included in a match with any type, a specific power-up is used. There are boosters that make all the remaining candy of that type float to the top of the board, double the multiplier or make the surrounding candy explode. Available boosters are shown on the right side of the board. By creating matches of pieces with the colour next to it, it is introduced to the board when the meter is full. Before starting a new level you choose a monster to have it level up just like the player character. Each new player level provides currency rewards and there are daily rewards as well. Additional currency can be bought as in-app purchases.

By signing into the game with a Microsoft account it is possible to customize the monsters' looks, visit new worlds, earn achievements and access the leaderboards, and challenge other players. There is a waiting time / stamina system to the game when visiting multiple locations in successions. Players either have to wait, spend purple gems or watch a video ad to access the next location. Up to three stars can be earned per level based on the total score.

sample_screenshots.caption: Adopt the monster or ignore it.
To access a number of features you need to sign in.

title: Monsters Love Candy

description: The 80's icon Frogger returns in Frogger's Crackout, a block-breaking game inspired by Breakout and the likes. The controls are designed with touchscreens in mind and let the player aim and fire at blocks with a slingshot. The goal of the game is to destroy all the blocks on each level without letting the projectile fall at the bottom of the screen. Various bonuses can be collected to provide help. As blocks are destroyed, Frogger evolves from an egg into a tadpole, then into two intermediate stages and finally into a frog, with its speed increasing at each stage.

sample_screenshots.caption: Frogger has evolved into a tadpole

title: Frogger's Crackout

description:
Bejeweled Live is the first version of the series for Windows Apps. It is based on Bejeweled 3, but the game modes included are not identical to the Windows Phone versions Bejeweled Live and Bejeweled Live+.

The player is presented with a board filled with gems of different colours. The aim of the game is to remove gems from the board by swapping adjacent gems so that a chain of three or more gems is created. New gems will then be generated at the top of the screen and fall down in the empty spaces. This can lead to a chain reaction when gems fall down and create new matches. It is possible to continue swapping gems during a chain reaction. There are some special gems. Flame gems are created from a match of four gems and explode when matched, thereby removing surrounding gems. A match of five gems will create a hypercube which can be matched with any adjacent gem and then destroy all gems of that colour. Star gems are created by T- or L-shaped matches and destroy all gems that are right, left, up and down of the it.

This version of the game includes three game modes: Classic, Diamond Mine and Butterflies. Classic is a series of levels presented as an endless mode. There is no timer or special objectives. Players make matches until no more moves are possible. Diamond Mine is played against the clock and matches need to be made to destroy dirt at the bottom. All dirt needs to be removed before time runs out. By digging through the dirt gold and treasures can be unearthed for extra points. Butterflies introduces a spider near the top of the screen that eats butterflies. The goal of this mode is to keep butterfly gems away from the spider by creating matches.

sample_screenshots.caption: The Hypercube removes all gems of a single type (Classic mode)
A match with a flame game (Classic mode)
An early game in the Classic mode

title: Bejeweled: Live

description:
This PC release is exclusive to the Windows Store and it is the second release of the Xbox Gears of War franchise on the PC platform since Gears of War in 2007. It contains the remastered Xbox One version Gears of War: Ultimate Edition released in 2015 and it has some additional content as well. This release contains:

  • Gears of War: Ultimate Edition (base game)
  • Gears of War: Ultimate Edition - Deluxe Weapon Skin Pack (DLC)
  • 11 additional multiplayer character skins

On the technical side resolutions up to 4K are supported (only on Windows 10) and the refresh rates for both the campaign and multiplayer are unlocked.
title: Gears of War: Ultimate Edition

description:
Halo 5: Forge is the first time the Forge component of the Halo first-person shooter series is available on a PC platform. This free release has the Forge mode, first introduced in Halo 3, which allows players to create and share maps for custom maps and full game modes. Creations can be shared with the Halo 5: Guardians Xbox One game and vice versa. It does not include any other content from Halo 5 such as the single-player mode or the full multiplayer part, but it lets players host and join custom games for Forge maps for up to sixteen players with all game elements and assets from the full game. Next to weapons, vehicles and game this includes prefabs, pre-assembled collections of blocks that can be saved and shared.

While multiplayer matches are possible it did not include any matchmaking functionalities when it was launched. Players need to exchange Xbox gamertags outside of the game to host and join each other's custom games. This release contains the entire Arena mode from Halo 5: Guardians with all 15 pre-made maps to play or edit. Available maps can be browsed through a content browser. Forge was not available on Xbox One at launch, but it was added in the Halo 5 Cartographer’s Gift update in December 2015.
title: Halo 5: Forge

description:
Forza Motorsport 6: Apex is the first game in the racing series to be made available for the PC platform. It is released as for free based on the Xbox One title Forza Motorsport 6. Many features and elements are carried over, but in a lighter or scaled-down version. A full career mode is included. By completing events RP (Racing Points) is provided as a currency and up to three medals can be earned based on the performance. New cars are also unlocked gradually. Microtransactions are used to unlock cars early, but this is not required. The car and track roster is based on Forza Motorsport 6 with 63 cars available at launch. It also carries over the Forzavista feature where all cars are fully functioning with working cockpits, doors, lights, sounds. The initial track list consists of six locations (Brands Hatch, Spa, Rio, Sebring, Top Gear, Yas Marina) with 20 configurations in total.

Next to Free Play there is a Showcase Tour with twelve events where players are introduced to different types of cars and races with narrated videos. In the Spotlight Series different types of events are introduced and updated or changed regularly with new challenges. Elements that are not carried over from Forza Motorsport 6 are multiplayer (both online and split-screen), car upgrades, mod cards, avatar design customization, the livery editor, UGC import, storefront, selling cars, the auction house, rivals, clubs, Playground, Rally, P2P. The Photo mode is available and there is a Practice option instead of Qualifying.
title: Forza Motorsport 6: Apex

description: The Gunstringer: Dead Man Running is an auto-run platformer where you play as The Gunstringer, a skeleton cowboy marionette. The game features fifteen levels where you must avoid obstacles and shoot enemies. Power-ups and weapons can be purchased with loot earned in each level.
title: The Gunstringer: Dead Man Running

description: Reckless Racing: Ultimate is an arcade racing game building on the gameplay of the earlier mobile version Reckless Racing, but with an entirely new game. Players get to drive and customize 24 different vehicles unlocked and upgraded gradually. Environments are both urban and off-road with drifting mechanics. There is a career mode with twenty cups and also 50 separate arcade challenges. There are 150 events in total to customize. The game supports online multiplayer.
title: Reckless Racing: Ultimate

description:
Halo Recruit is a virtual reality game and a part of the Halo Franchise.

Halo Recruit features a small story where a new recruit (the player) gets an introduction about weapons and enemies, before jumping into battle. 343 Guilty Spark introduces himself and teaches the player about several Covenant species, including the Unggoy (Grunts) through the use of holograms. The player can then choose between two weapons, the SMG or the pistol. With this the player has to shoot several waves of enemies. After the enemies are dead or the time runs out, the player will be ranked based upon how many kills were obtained.

Players then meet Master Chief Petty Officer John-117, main character of most Halo games. Master Chief enters a Warthog and tells the player to get onto the gun, ending the short game.
title: Halo: Recruit
Europa Universalis IV: Empire Founder Pack

description: Candy Jelly Madness is a tile-matching puzzle game with candies for tiles. Joining more candies in a single line will give bonuses, including completing a level sooner. There are power-ups, some of which come as in-app purchases, and a rating systems from 1 to 3 stars for the player's performance in a level.
title: Candy Jelly Madness

sample_screenshots.caption: Collect all three nebulas to finish the level.

description:
Forza Motorsport 6: Apex (Premium Edition) is a special edition. Next to the base game Forza Motorsport 6: Apex it contains:

  • The Power to Weight car pack, featuring seven new cars
  • The Heavy Racers car pack, featuring seven new cars
  • The Nurburgring track pack, featuring the famous track playable in all time/weather conditions on three different courses
title: Forza Motorsport 6: Apex (Premium Edition)

description: Shuttles is a strategy game, requiring the player to get all five pegs on the opposite side before the opposing player does. On each turn, a player slides one of the seven shuttle pieces and repositions a peg to an adjacent hole (horizontally or vertically), until it reaches the opposite side. Due to the maze-like barriers on the shuttle pieces, it can be tricky to navigate pegs, especially if the player decides to slide a shuttle to block the path of a peg.
title: Shuttles
